Package ss.pentago.tui

Class BotInputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.client.InputHandler
      • ss.pentago.tui.OfflineTextInputHandler
        • ss.pentago.tui.OnlineTextInputHandler
          • ss.pentago.tui.BotInputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class BotInputHandler
extends OnlineTextInputHandler
    BotInputHandler extends OnlineTextInputHandler by automatically sending commands to the server, while still providing some basic user options through a text-based interface to control the Bot.
    The BotInputHandler tries to queue for games and play them automatically by calling the associated Client's player (AIPlayer) to generate a move.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BotInputHandler

        public BotInputHandler​(OnlineClient client)
        Creates a new BotInputHandler object, which sends automated requests and AI-generated moves to a server. This type of InputHandler only supports some basic commands for the operating user, as all gameplay related commands are handled automatically.
        Parameters:
        client - the client to send input to

    • Method Detail

      • parseCommand

        protected boolean parseCommand​(java.lang.String command)
        Parses the supplied command, and tells the Client what to do.
        Overrides:
        parseCommand in class OnlineTextInputHandler
        Parameters:
        command - the command
        Returns:
        false if the client needs to be stopped (due to messages not being sent in case of a closed connection), true otherwise

      • setUsername

        protected void setUsername​(java.lang.String username)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Generate a random username for this bot.
        Overrides:
        setUsername in class OnlineTextInputHandler
        Parameters:
        username - the username (ignored)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the Server closed the connection

      • run

        public void run()
        While running, generate AI moves/commands, and read from System.in to listen for bot control commands. Parse the input and tell the Client what to do. On exit, call the associated Client's close().
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class OnlineTextInputHandler
